tn.ref: Now the Philistines fought against Israel
tn.text: This battle was the result of the conflict between David and the Philistines in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:29:10|29:11]]. The writer has finished telling the story of David in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:30:01|30:1-30]], and now he tells about the battle between the Israelites and the Philistines.
"the Philistines fought against the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is the name of a mountain (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).

tn.ref: closely pursued Saul and his sons
tn.text: "chased Saul and three of his sons"
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).

tn.ref: The battle went heavily against Saul
tn.text: This is an idiom.  "Saul's army began to lose the battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The armor bearer carried the large shield of his commanding officer and other weapons. He protected the commanding officer during a battle.

The nominal adjective "uncircumcised" can be translated as an adjective. AT: "these men who have not been circumcised" Not being circumcised is a metonym for being foreigners. AT: "these non-Israelite men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The ellipsis can be filled in. AT:  "would not do what Saul had told him to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: took his own sword and fell on it
tn.text: "killed himself with his own sword"
"on that one day"
lived in the cities the men of Israel had left
take the armor and weapons off the dead Israelites' bodies
a mountain range overlooking the Valley of Jezreel in northern Israel, south of Nazareth (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the land of the Philistines throughout
tn.text: "all areas of the land of the Philistines"

tn.ref: to carry the news to their idols' temples and to the people
tn.text: "to speak the news inside the temples and to the people"
the buildings where they worshiped their idols
an ancient false goddess and idol, also called "Asherah" or "Astarte"
"attached" (probably with a large spike or nail)
the name of a city (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
the name of a town. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:11:01|11:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: what the Philistines had done to Saul
tn.text: "how the Philistines had dishonored Saul"
"throughout the whole night"
This is a type of tree. AT: "a large shade tree" Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:22:06|22:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
